title: Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail: Park Home
body: A Walk through History  The 450-mile foot trail that became known as the Natchez Trace was the lifeline through the Old Southwest.  You can experience portions of that journey the way earlier travelers did - on foot.  Today there are five separate trails totaling over 60 miles and they are administered by the Natchez Trace Parkway.              Hike a Section of the Scenic Trail   Download a map and follow in the footsteps of the of boatmen, settlers, American Indians, and slaves who hiked the old Natchez Trace.
